_header: Behold mine wounds and have them in thine thought
_description: A knight at the point of death sends a letter to his wife — verse from an exemplum in Dives and Pauper translating the same Latin distich as that in 810

BodDou295.Transcription:
Beholde myn woundes and have hem in þine þouȝteFor
                    alle the good þat ben þine with myn blod I haue hem
                    bouȝte
BodDou295.Editions:
Woolf,  Rosemary. 
             The English Religious Lyric in the Middle Ages.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1968: 48.

BodEngTheold36.Transcription:
Beholde my woundes and haue hem in þi þouȝteffor alle
                    þe goodis þat ben þine Wiþ my blood Ihaue hem
                    bouȝt
BodEngTheold36.Editions:
Sheeran,  Francis J. 
             “Ten Verse Fragments in Dives and Pauper.” 
             Neuphilologische Mitteilungen
         76 (1975): 257-70: 264.
